headline: Republican Bernie Moreno drops out of crowded Ohio Senate primary
sentences:
Trump backed the move with a statement released soon after Moreno’s, thanking the candidate for his “time and effort.”
“I was very impressed with Bernie who was tough on illegal immigration which, after the Biden disaster at the Border, has become a big issue for all candidates,” Trump said.

Moreno said that during a private meeting with Trump Thursday afternoon, the two agreed the race was filled with too many “Trump candidates,” which could threaten the MAGA movement’s chances of holding onto the Senate seat.

To whomever wins the Senate race, I hope and pray they take the actions needed to stop illegal immigration, bring our manufacturing base back to America, and shrink the size and scale of the Federal Government.

| Aaron Doster/AP Photo
By Myah Ward
 02/03/2022 09:24 PM EST
Republican Bernie Moreno on Thursday dropped out of the crowded Ohio Senate primary, citing a conversation with former President Donald Trump.
Republican Bernie Moreno, a luxury car dealer and now blockchain businessman, was one of the leading GOP contenders throwing in cash at a contest to replace retiring Republican Sen.
Vance, former state treasurer Josh Mandel, state Sen. Matt Dolan, investment banker Mike Gibbons and former Ohio state GOP chair Jane Timken to battle it out for the nomination.

Moreno said he’ll focus on supporting the candidate who wins Trump’s endorsement.
The winner will likely face Rep. Tim Ryan, a Democrat facing an uphill battle in a state that’s turned more Republican.
Moreno gave $3.75 million of his own money to his campaign and launched a $4 million television ad spree in December.
